intro: Tambourissa paradoxa, commonly known as the paradoxical tambourissa, is a rare and unique flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and small trees. The plant is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and often have a velvety texture. Due to its rarity and distinctive appearance, it is of interest to botanists and plant enthusiasts alike.
